intro: Dodecatheon crenatum, commonly known as the scalycup flower, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, nodding flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces showy, cup-like bracts that enclose the actual flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dodecatheon crenatum thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
